intro: Bulbostylis woronowii, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, grassy leaves and small, clustered flowers. Native to Southeast Asia, this plant typically grows in wet or marshy habitats. It has a short, rhizomatous stem and produces tiny, inconspicuous blooms that are often clustered at the tips of the stems. Due to its delicate structure and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
